title: Is a PGDM better than an MS degree in Canada? - Quora

response.answer_text: A Post Graduate Diploma is an 8–12 months course that approximately costs C$13000-C$16000 per year. It has a co-op program included in it and entrance exams such as GMAT/GRE are not required. An 8 month program gets 8 months work permit and 12 months program gets a 12 months work permit. Courses are designed taking industry practical vocational happenings into considerations. Master’s programs on the other hand, require students to have 16 years of education and is 2–2.5 years in duration. The course approximately costs C$17000-C$19000 per year. With co-operative education included in the program, GMAT/GRE may be required. A 2 year program gets 3 years of open work permit and work experience may be required for certain MBA programs. The courses are designed in a more theoretical perspective.
MS from Canada is more valuable than PGDBM.
